page.title: 17Religion 2
page.content: All-Saints Church, Highertown was recently upgraded into a fully-fledged Parish Church, because of the growth of new estates in the area, mainly at Newbridge and Nansavallon. It has been refurbished, and takes part in many local activities; a Church Fete raised Â£2,000 recently. The Roman Catholic Church is represented in the area by Our Lady of the Portal with St Piran, where there are connections with the Carmelite Order, and the Knights of St Columba; the parish covers our entire block. The Non-conformist Methodist tradition in Cornwall is represented by St Mary Clement, Union Place,centre of a thriving community. The Society of Friends,the Quakers, have a meeting place in Pauls Terrace. The Salvation Army has a base in Kenwyn Street. The Jehovah's Witnesses have a thriving centre in Dobbs Lane.
